subject: RE: [junit] Looking for a JUnit diff and trend analysis tool
msgSnippet: I don t know of anything like this.  Writing a tool like this is on my to do list at work, but there are about 60 things above it, so don t hold your breath.
messageBody:
I don't know of anything like this. Writing a tool like this is on my
"to do" list at work, but there are about 60 things above it, so don't
hold your breath.


Todd.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of kp.berg
> Sent: Tuesday, January 03, 2006 2:57 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Looking for a JUnit diff and trend analysis tool
>
> Hi all,
>
> I know, JUnit 'unit' tests should always pass ;-) But we are
> using the JUnit framework to write integration and
> systemtests as well. So from time to time, in this area
> something may go wrong. Therefore I'm looking for a tool,
> that generates a report showing only the differences between
> current and last JUnit report - which failing tests were
> fixed, which tests stopped to pass, which tests were added
> and which removed. Additionaly a test trend analysis should
> be possible.
>
> I know, parsing the XML junitreport output and generating the
> info, e.g., with the help of a database, would be possible.
> But is anyone aware of an existing tool or open source
> project that can help in this direction?
>
> --Klaus
>
>
>
>
>
